title: Akayu Ramen (Yamagata Style Complete Bowl)
steps: Preheat your serving bowl by placing it in a 170°F (77°C) oven, or by filling it with hot water.
Prepare all toppings and have them ready (slice chashu, halve eggs, slice green onions).
Bring a large pot of water to a rapid boil for cooking the noodles.
Heat the Akayu Chintan broth to a simmer.
When ready to assemble, empty the preheated bowl and add the Sweet Miso Tare (50g) to the bottom of the bowl.
Add the Lard (20g) to the bowl.
Add the Akayu Spice Ball (40g) to the bowl.
Add the hot Akayu Chintan broth (300g) to the bowl and whisk to incorporate the miso tare and spice ball.
Cook the Akayu Style Noodles (180g) in the boiling water according to the noodle recipe instructions.
When noodles are done, immediately drain them thoroughly in a fine mesh strainer, shaking vigorously to remove excess water.
Add the drained noodles to the bowl of soup. Use chopsticks to separate and arrange the noodles if desired.
Add toppings: place chashu at 6 o'clock position, egg at 11-12 o'clock, green onions in the center, and nori at 1-2 o'clock (add nori last as it gets soggy quickly).
notes: Component recipes needed: yamagata-akayu-chintan, sweet-miso-tare-akayu-style, lard, akayu-spicy-miso-ball, akayu-style-noodle
Prepare all component recipes in advance before assembly.
Akayu ramen is a regional specialty from Yamagata prefecture featuring a spicy miso ball that dissolves in the soup.
The spice ball adds both heat and complexity to the sweet miso broth.
This style uses a larger portion of noodles (180g) compared to other styles.
Work quickly when adding noodles to prevent them from becoming sticky or overcooked.
50g of miso tare is thick, 20 mL of lard equals approximately 20g, 300 mL of broth equals approximately 300g.
